fields.description: As a cloud administrator I would like a "global" IAM service so I do not have to manage identities and policies separately on each of my clouds.

comments.body:
This story is for federated regions (clouds) having the same IAM resources for end user accounts. Administrative use of IAM across regions will not be transparent due to this story, for example listing accounts on different clouds will show the accounts present on only that cloud.

Specific use cases for this story are:

* Direct use of the IAM service in a region other than an accounts "home" region.
* Use of the IAM service in a region other than the accounts "home" region via CloudFormation (i.e. IAM resources in a template)
* Creation of an account in any region with alias "global" uniqueness enforced
* Changing the alias for an account with "global" uniqueness enforced
* Importing an X.509 signing certificate into a cloud with "global" uniqueness enforced
* Administrator use of the IAM service using "--as-account" in a region other than the delegate accounts "home" region (via the administrators home region)

For globally unique values it is expected that a value will be unavailable for a short (reservation) period after use. This means (for example) that you cannot create an account with an alias, delete it, and then immediately create another account with the same alias.

This story does not cover runtime use of server certificates, but does cover server certificate management via the IAM service.

Confirmed following use case:
{quote}
Direct use of the IAM service in a region other than an accounts "home" region
{quote}

Eucalyptus Version:  {{4.2.0-0.0.23586.540.20150623git1ad8a4a.el6}}

*Steps*

# Set up federated cloud (4 regions; 2 multi-cluster, 2 single cluster)
{code}
# euca-describe-regions
REGION	ace-hood	http://compute.g-19-05.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	big-krit	http://compute.d-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	bob	http://compute.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	ghostface-killah	http://compute.g-12-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
{code}
#* [region big-krit|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/466/]
#* [region ghostface-killah|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/465/]
#* [region bob|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/464/]
#* [region ace-hood|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/463/]
# On ace-hood region, downloaded cloud admin (eucalyptus/admin) credentials, then created account 'development-operations'
{code}
# euare-accountcreate -a development-operations
{code}
# Downloaded credentials creds for development-operations/admin user, sourced creds, then created users using IAM endpoint for each region:
{code}
# source development-operations/eucarc
# euare-userlistbypath
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/admin
# euare-usercreate -u inspectah-deck --url http://euare.g-12-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
# euare-usercreate -u u-god --url http://euare.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
# euare-usercreate -u gza --url http://euare.d-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
# euare-usercreate -u rza --url http://euare.g-19-05.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
# euare-userlistbypath
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/admin
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/inspectah-deck
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/u-god
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/gza
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/rza
{code}

Confirmed following use case:
{quote}
Use of the IAM service in a region other than the accounts "home" region via CloudFormation (i.e. IAM resources in a template)
{quote}
Eucalyptus Version: {{4.2.0-0.0.23586.540.20150623git1ad8a4a.el6}}

*Steps*

# Set up federated cloud (4 regions; 2 multi-cluster, 2 single cluster)
{code}
# euca-describe-regions
REGION	ace-hood	http://compute.g-19-05.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	big-krit	http://compute.d-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	bob	http://compute.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	ghostface-killah	http://compute.g-12-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
{code}
#* [region big-krit|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/466/]
#* [region ghostface-killah|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/465/]
#* [region bob|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/464/]
#* [region ace-hood|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/463/]
# On ace-hood region, downloaded cloud admin (eucalyptus/admin) credentials, then created account 'development-operations'
{code}
# euare-accountcreate -a development-operations
{code}
# Downloaded credentials creds for development-operations/admin user.
# Did a clone of s3cmd repository from Github
{code}
# git clone https://github.com/s3tools/s3cmd.git
{code}
# Created configuration file for s3cfg
{code}
# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --configure

Enter new values or accept defaults in brackets with Enter.
Refer to user manual for detailed description of all options.

Access key and Secret key are your identifiers for Amazon S3. Leave them empty for using the env variables.
Access Key [AKIAB7EQYNDJSARHDMFT]:
Secret Key [HFFHt7cDV3x3i0AUCLXTRK5VTSPwZWbGtBmHFrbS]:
Default Region [US]:

Encryption password is used to protect your files from reading
by unauthorized persons while in transfer to S3
Encryption password:
Path to GPG program [/usr/bin/gpg]:

When using secure HTTPS protocol all communication with Amazon S3
[default]
servers is protected from 3rd party eavesdropping. This method is
cloudfront_host = cloudfront.amazonaws.com
slower than plain HTTP, and can only be proxied with Python 2.7 or newer
[default]
Use HTTPS protocol [No]:
[default]

[default]
On some networks all internet access must go through a HTTP proxy.
Try setting it here if you can't connect to S3 directly
HTTP Proxy server name:

New settings:
  Access Key: AKIAB7EQYNDJSARHDMFT
  Secret Key: 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
  Default Region: US
  Encryption password:
  Path to GPG program: /usr/bin/gpg
  Use HTTPS protocol: False
  HTTP Proxy server name:
  HTTP Proxy server port: 0

Test access with supplied credentials? [Y/n] n

Save settings? [y/N] y
Configuration saved to '/root/.s3cfg'
{code}
# Made copies of s3cmd configuration file for each region, and updated {{host_base}} and {{host_bucket}} to point to associated region:
{code}
# mv .s3cfg .s3cfg-devops-ace-hood
# cp .s3cfg-devops-ace-hood .s3cfg-devops-big-krit
# cp .s3cfg-devops-ace-hood .s3cfg-devops-bob
# cp .s3cfg-devops-ace-hood .s3cfg-devops-ghostface-killah
{code}
# Created buckets on a couple of regions, and listed bucket created for each region:
{code}
# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=.s3cfg-devops-ghostface-killah --signature-v2 ls
2015-06-26 03:51  s3://redis-logs
# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=.s3cfg-devops-bob --signature-v2 ls
2015-06-26 02:11  s3://apache-logs
# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=.s3cfg-devops-big-krit --signature-v2 ls
2015-06-26 03:49  s3://mongodb-logs
# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=.s3cfg-devops-ace-hood --signature-v2 ls
2015-06-26 02:10  s3://nginx-logs
{code}

Confirmed the following use case {color:red}*failed*{color}:
{quote}
Changing the alias for an account with "global" uniqueness enforced
{quote}
Eucalyptus Version: {{4.2.0-0.0.23586.540.20150623git1ad8a4a.el6}}

*Steps*

# Set up federated cloud (4 regions; 2 multi-cluster, 2 single cluster)
{code}
# euca-describe-regions
REGION	ace-hood	http://compute.g-19-05.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	big-krit	http://compute.d-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	bob	http://compute.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	ghostface-killah	http://compute.g-12-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
{code}
#* [region big-krit|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/466/]
#* [region ghostface-killah|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/465/]
#* [region bob|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/464/]
#* [region ace-hood|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/463/]
# On ace-hood region, downloaded cloud admin (eucalyptus/admin) credentials, then created account 'development-operations'
{code}
# euare-accountcreate -a development-operations
{code}
# Created alias for development-operations account
{code}
# euare-accountaliascreate devops
# euare-accountlist
devops	001310814050
{code}
# On region 'big-krit', downloaded eucalyptus/admin credentials, and created 'sales' account:
{code}
# euare-accountcreate -a sales
sales	003047974133
{code}
# On region 'big-krit', changed the account alias of 'sales' account to 'devops', which is already used with account created on 'ace-hood' region:
{code}
# euare-accountlist
sales	003047974133

## source eucalyptus/admin creds from 'big-krit' region, and display users from 'devops' account ##
# source eucarc
# euare-userlistbypath --as-account devops
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/admin
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/inspectah-deck
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/u-god
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/gza
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/rza

## source sales/admin creds, then change accountalias to 'devops' ##
# source sales/eucarc
# euare-accountaliascreate devops
# euare-accountlist
devops	003047974133
{code}

Confirmed the following use case:
{quote}
Administrator use of the IAM service using "--as-account" in a region other than the delegate accounts "home" region (via the administrators home region)
{quote}
Eucalyptus Version: {{4.2.0-0.0.23586.540.20150623git1ad8a4a.el6}}

*Steps*

# Set up federated cloud (4 regions; 2 multi-cluster, 2 single cluster)
{code}
# euca-describe-regions
REGION	ace-hood	http://compute.g-19-05.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	big-krit	http://compute.d-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	bob	http://compute.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	ghostface-killah	http://compute.g-12-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
{code}
#* [region big-krit|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/466/]
#* [region ghostface-killah|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/465/]
#* [region bob|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/464/]
#* [region ace-hood|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/463/]
# On ace-hood region, downloaded cloud admin (eucalyptus/admin) credentials, then created account 'development-operations'
{code}
# euare-accountcreate -a development-operations
{code}
# Created alias for development-operations account
{code}
# euare-accountaliascreate devops
# euare-accountlist
devops	001310814050
{code}
# On region 'big-krit', downloaded eucalyptus/admin credentials, source the eucarc and listed groups and users under 'devops' account:
{code}
# euare-grouplistbypath --as-account devops
groups
# euare-userlistbypath --as-account devops
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/admin
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/inspectah-deck
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/u-god
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/gza
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/rza
{code}

Confirmed the following use case {color:red}*failed due to inconsistent error messaging*{color}:
{quote}
Importing an X.509 signing certificate into a cloud with "global" uniqueness enforced
{quote}
Eucalyptus Version: {{4.2.0-0.0.23586.540.20150623git1ad8a4a.el6}}

*Steps*

# Set up federated cloud (4 regions; 2 multi-cluster, 2 single cluster)
{code}
# euca-describe-regions
REGION	ace-hood	http://compute.g-19-05.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	big-krit	http://compute.d-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	bob	http://compute.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	ghostface-killah	http://compute.g-12-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
{code}
#* [region big-krit|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/466/]
#* [region ghostface-killah|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/465/]
#* [region bob|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/464/]
#* [region ace-hood|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/463/]
# On ace-hood region, downloaded cloud admin (eucalyptus/admin) credentials, then created account 'development-operations'
{code}
# euare-accountcreate -a development-operations
{code}
# Downloaded development-operations/admin user credentials and sourced eucarc
{code}
# source development-operations/eucarc
{code}
# Following the instructions mentioned in the [KB article that discusses how to create an HTTPS/SSL ELB|https://support.eucalyptus.com/hc/en-us/articles/202440330-Steps-to-Create-HTTPS-SSL-Elastic-Load-Balancer-on-Eucalyptus?flash_digest=cbee95f1f15dc4c5b6f5956f08371bdf1898475a], created private key and self-signed certificate using openssl, then created a IAM server certificate using euare-servercertupload:
{code}
# euare-servercertlistbypath
# openssl genrsa 2048 > devops.pem
# openssl req -new -x509 -key devops.pem -out devops-cert.pem -days 1095
# openssl rsa -in devops.pem -outform PEM > devops-pem.pem
# openssl x509 -inform PEM -in devops-cert.pem > devops-cert-pem.pem
# euare-servercertupload --server-certificate-name devops-qa --certificate-file devops-cert-pem.pem --private-key-file devops-pem.pem
# euare-servercertlistbypath
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:server-certificate/devops-qa
{code}
# Attempted to create IAM server certificate with same name, except point to the different regions.  Notice that the error message returned is not the same as the error returned from the native region of the account credentials:
{code}
# euca-describe-regions
REGION	ace-hood	http://compute.g-19-05.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	big-krit	http://compute.d-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	bob	http://compute.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	ghostface-killah	http://compute.g-12-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/

(native region)
# euare-servercertupload --server-certificate-name devops-qa --certificate-file devops-cert-pem.pem --private-key-file devops-pem.pem --url http://euare.g-19-05.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
euare-servercertupload: error (EntityAlreadyExists): Server certificate devops-qa already exists.

(non-native regions)
# euare-servercertupload --server-certificate-name devops-qa --certificate-file devops-cert-pem.pem --private-key-file devops-pem.pem --url http://euare.d-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
euare-servercertupload: error (InternalFailure): com.eucalyptus.ws.EucalyptusRemoteFault: Action:ProblemAction Code:InternalError Id:RelatesTo Error: Failed to send message UploadServerCertificateType to service EuareInternal because: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{EuareInternalLocal.component}. Message payload is of type: UploadServerCertificateTypeFailed to send message UploadServerCertificateType to service EuareInternal because: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{EuareInternalLocal.component}. Message payload is of type: UploadServerCertificateType

# euare-servercertupload --server-certificate-name devops-qa --certificate-file devops-cert-pem.pem --private-key-file devops-pem.pem --url http://euare.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
euare-servercertupload: error (InternalFailure): com.eucalyptus.ws.EucalyptusRemoteFault: Action:ProblemAction Code:InternalError Id:RelatesTo Error: Failed to send message UploadServerCertificateType to service EuareInternal because: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{EuareInternalLocal.component}. Message payload is of type: UploadServerCertificateTypeFailed to send message UploadServerCertificateType to service EuareInternal because: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{EuareInternalLocal.component}. Message payload is of type: UploadServerCertificateType

 euare-servercertupload --server-certificate-name devops-qa --certificate-file devops-cert-pem.pem --private-key-file devops-pem.pem --url http://euare.g-12-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
euare-servercertupload: error (InternalFailure): com.eucalyptus.ws.EucalyptusRemoteFault: Action:ProblemAction Code:InternalError Id:RelatesTo Error: Failed to send message UploadServerCertificateType to service EuareInternal because: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{EuareInternalLocal.component}. Message payload is of type: UploadServerCertificateTypeFailed to send message UploadServerCertificateType to service EuareInternal because: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{EuareInternalLocal.component}. Message payload is of type: UploadServerCertificateType
{code}
Thanks [~hspencer], the story is completed. Please open bugs for any issues found.

Fixed version:  {{4.2.0-0.0.23586.540.20150623git1ad8a4a.el6}}

Story has been completed.  Any issues found during use case confirmation have been linked to this ticket.  Please see prior comments to observe steps performed for each use case.

[~sjones],

Understood.  Raised the following tickets and linked them:
\\
* EUCA-11033
* EUCA-11032

Let me know if you have any questions.
